snippet: The state-run news media released a televised confession of one man, and identified two other suspects in the assault.
abstract: Chinese authorities release video purportedly showing fatal knife attack at coal mine in Xinjiang region was motivated by jihadist sentiments; link their efforts to calm region's restive Uighur minority with global campaign against religious violence; selective disclosures suggest effort to downplay extent of ethnic tensions between Uighurs and Han migrants.
lead_paragraph: The state-run news media released a televised confession of one man, and identified two other suspects in the assault.

headline.main: Suspect in Xinjiang Mine Attack Spoke of Jihad, Chinese News Reports Say
headline.print_headline: Jihad Said to Be Motive in Chinese Mine Attack
